intro: Secamone galinae, commonly known as the Galinae secamone, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy in the family. Secamone galinae is often found in woodland and shrubland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
